definition: to step out/to take a (first) step
to take a step/to stride

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: It starts with that deep breath of confidence you take before the first step.
sentences.chinese: 千里之行，开始于迈出第一步前那口自信的深呼吸。

sentences.english: The third improvement is audio quality, which has taken a gigantic step forward.
sentences.chinese: 第三个改进是音质，这一点相较以前迈出了一大步。

sentences.english: You will make long strides in your career this year - as long as you keep faith in yourself.
sentences.chinese: 只要相信自己双子就会在职业生涯中会迈出一大步。

sentences.english: If you have done this, you have taken the first step for success.
sentences.chinese: 假如你已经这么做了，那么你已向成功迈出了第一步。

sentences.english: The study benefits ultra-sound quantitative diagnosis.
sentences.chinese: 在超声定量诊断研究上迈出了一步。

sentences.english: Abe told reporters after the talks that the countries made a "first step" toward reconciliation.
sentences.chinese: 会谈后，安倍对记者说，两国朝和解迈出了第一步。

sentences.english: And this year is as good as any to do that.
sentences.chinese: 而今年，跟任何一年一样，都是迈出新步伐的好时机。

sentences.english: But keep in mind this is a baby step on a long road to a truly market-determined yuan exchange rate.
sentences.chinese: 但是要记住，漫漫长路我们才迈出了一小步。

sentences.english: This initiative is an important step toward reversing the resource curse.
sentences.chinese: 这个动议是朝着扭转资源诅咒迈出的重要一步。

sentences.english: It is a small step in reducing the bigotry of monocultures.
sentences.chinese: 这位减少单一文化的偏执迈出了一小步。

sentences.english: This is an important step in the right direction.
sentences.chinese: “这是朝着正确方向迈出的重要一步”。

sentences.english: And the above points are a great step forward for SNDA.
sentences.chinese: 上述各点是SNDA向前迈出的一大步。

sentences.english: This hearing was a major step forward in getting the bill passed.
sentences.chinese: 这场听证会向法案的最终通过迈出了重要的一步。

sentences.english: Take just 1 step forward today. What will it be?
sentences.chinese: 今天只向前迈出1步，将会是什么样的状况呢？

sentences.english: Torquato et. al. paper thus represents the first step towards a similar approach.
sentences.chinese: 的论文代表了纳米科技中向类似途径迈出的第一步。

sentences.english: She's the one who helps you for the first step, she's the one who bares all the mishap.
sentences.chinese: 她帮助你迈出第一步，她会帮你承受所有的不幸。

definition: surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to step in/to stride forward/to forge ahead
large strides
to stride toward (success)/to march toward/to take a step toward
step/pace
pace/(measured) step/march
to take a step/to stride
firm and substantial/solid
to surmount/to cross over
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to set foot in/to tread (in or on)/to walk into
forward/onward
footstep/step
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
to fall to the ground/to be set on the ground/to reach to the ground/to be born/(of a plane) to land
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
